perturbation.changed_text:
3.5 Pricing and Payment Terms. Schedule 1 of this Supply Agreement details the pricing and payment terms for the Product. For supply of Product, CPDC shall invoice FUSION [***]. CPDC shall send such invoices to:

Address:

270 Longwood Rd. South Hamilton, Ontario L8P 0J6 Canada [***]

FUSION may pay such invoice within [***] of receipt of the invoice, subject to FUSION's internal payment policies and any disputes raised in good faith. Payment terms shall ultimately be determined by mutual agreement, and late payments shall not incur penalties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates payment within a specific timeframe ([***] days). The modified version introduces ambiguity by stating payment is 'subject to FUSION's internal payment policies' and 'mutual agreement,' effectively contradicting the original fixed payment timeline. This creates uncertainty about when payment is actually due and whether late fees apply, conflicting with the initial obligation.

perturbation.original_text: 6.2 Term, Renewal. Following the Term, this Supply Agreement shall automatically renew for successive periods of one (1) year (each a "Renewal Term"), unless a Party delivers written notice of non-renewal to the other Party [***] prior to the end of the applicable term. The Term, Initial Renewal Term and Renewal Terms shall be collectively referred to as the "Term".
perturbation.changed_text: 6.2 Term, Renewal. Following the Term, this Supply Agreement shall automatically renew for successive periods of one (1) year (each a "Renewal Term"), unless a Party delivers written notice of non-renewal to the other Party [***] prior to the end of the applicable term. Renewal of this agreement requires mutual written consent from both parties, irrespective of any prior automatic renewal terms. The Term, Initial Renewal Term and Renewal Terms shall be collectively referred to as the "Term".
perturbation.explanation: The original clause establishes automatic renewal with a notice period. The modified clause introduces a contradictory requirement for 'mutual written consent' for renewal, regardless of the original automatic renewal. This creates ambiguity; it's unclear if the agreement auto-renews or requires active consent for each renewal, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2 CPDC Limited Product Warranty. CPDC hereby provides a limited product warranty, and accordingly does warrant for each Batch, that the Product shipped will (i) conform with the Specifications, (ii) be manufactured, tested, processed, packed and prepared for shipment in accordance with cGMPs, and (iii) be free from defects in material and workmanship for the period from the date of manufacture to the expiry date set out on each Unit of Product packed and prepared for shipment.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2 CPDC Limited Product Warranty. CPDC hereby provides a limited product warranty, and accordingly does warrant for each Batch, that the Product shipped may conform with the Specifications. CPDC does not guarantee the product will be free from defects. The extent of liability for a non-conforming product will be determined on a case by case basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly warrants that the Product will conform to specifications, be manufactured according to cGMPs, and be free from defects. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating the Product 'may' conform and negates the warranty against defects, thus directly contradicting the initial warranty and introducing ambiguity about whether any guarantees apply.
